chapter.title: Installation
chapter.p: This chapter covers the installation of ecromedos from source and binary packages.

section.title: Obtaining the Latest Version
section.p: The latest version of the software can be obtained from the project's website at http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;ecromedos.&zwsp;net. You will find a tarball for manual installation and binary packages for selected platforms.

section.title: Dependencies
section.p: For proper operation, ecromedos depends on the following third-party software offerings:

dd.p: A powerful scripting language. Python is available for all popular operating systems and can be obtained from the website of the Python Software Foundation at http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;python.&zwsp;org. You will need version 2.4 or later to run ecromedos. Please note that ecromedos is not yet ready for Python 3.

Two super fast and stable libraries for processing XML, developed by Daniel Veillard for the GNOME project. Both libraries offer bindings to Python. The project homepage is at http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;xmlsoft.&zwsp;org.

A set of tools for image manipulation. ecromedos uses Imagemagick for resizing bitmap images and to do format conversions. You can download the software from http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;imagemagick.&zwsp;org.

If you want to produce Postscript or PDF, you need an installation of the &tex; typesetting system. It is recommended that you use &tex; Live 2006 or later, available from http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;tug.&zwsp;org/&zwsp;texlive/. Using the once popular but no longer maintained te&tex; distribution together with ecromedos 2 is not recommended.

A utility to convert DVI files to PNG or GIF graphics. ecromedos needs this to convert mathematic formulas to bitmap graphics when generating XHTML output. dvipng is available from http://&zwsp;www.&zwsp;nongnu.&zwsp;org/&zwsp;dvipng/.

minisection.title: Adapting the Configuration
minisection.p: Having completed the installation procedure described above, you may now edit the configuration file ecmds.conf, which is located in the subdirectory etc below the installation folder. ecromedos is designed to be relocatable, so in many cases it should just work out of the box. However, the path settings pointing to third-party software that ecromedos relies on may have to be corrected. In particular, check all variables ending in _bin or _dir.

The value of a configuration variable can be reused in arguments to other variables by prepending a dollar sign to the name of the variable to be referenced. For instance, if base_dir is set to /opt/ecromedos-x.y.z/, then you can set lib_dir to /opt/ecromedos-x.y.z/lib by simply writing lib_dir = $base_dir/lib.
ecromedos 2 introduces the automatic variable $install_dir, which is set implicitely and points to the installation directory.
